8.6.21  12:49 pm   what's a good way to increase self-confidence?

8.6.21  11:59 am   how do you cope with the human condition?

      it's a 2 step process.
     1: take it to the next step
     2: figure out which step is next
and the whole key here is to figure out whether you're on step 1 or step 2, at any given time

8.6.21  10:11 am   camping advice?

      a lot of people get mixed up and think they need to buy a camper. but that's not true. it's you. you're the camper

8.6.21  10:04 am   do you ever just innovate at light speed

      yes, for brief moments

8.6.21  8:45 am   Hey bill, so there's this chord or something and I have no idea how to figure what it is. But the notes are D, E, and G, do you have any idea what the name of this chord is? Thabk you 

      it sounds like you figured out exactly what it is. you just can't find a name. and unfortunately, i can't really give you a name either, without context. assuming all 3 notes are above middle C, then all i can say is an ambiguous Emin7 at best, but different context or bass choices could make that anything from G6 to Cadd2

8.6.21  7:09 am   what are the departments of bill wurtz

      every department has 2 jobs.
     1: make more departments
     2: this could be problematic

8.6.21  6:19 am   hey bill I've been a huge fan for a while now and your videos have helped me tremendously. I'm in a deep depression at the moment and I feel really hopeless. I was wondering if you could possibly give me some advice to help with my situation. I've suddenly started getting constant brain fog/issues with thinking around a year ago which is SUPER scary considering I'm only 18 and it feels like no one takes me seriously even though it quite literally ruined my life and made me spiral into the worst depression ever. I have always been bad at figuring out what to do so I'm wondering what you would recommend I do. I would kill to go back to when I didn't have this crippling brain fog. I'm sure I'll be fine + I know you are probably the wrong person to be asking about stuff like this but I mean I don't know who else to go to I don't have many friends. anyways keep up what you're doing me and many others really appreciate it. <3

     the brain seems to have a natural ability to fog itself when the motivations are unclear, or when the feelings and thoughts aren't listening to each other. this can get fixed surprisingly quickly if you ever get reminded how deeply you you are and how truly you you can be. Anything can trigger this realization, even a leaf, or a piece of dirt. the evidence is everywhere, because it's true

8.5.21  11:55 pm   what do you think about computers existing

8.5.21  11:21 pm   how do you manage not to neglect sleep when everything the world has to offer almost begs you to

      just stay up, then eventually you will start getting INSANELY tired but you'll feel like you have to finish what you're doing because you know you'll probably forget it later, which is probably true, and so you finish the thing and then you're so excited from finishing the thing that you're not tired anymore so you stay up to celebrate, and THEN ......... you get to stage 4 which is the nightmare phase, when you physcally can't stay up but you also unfortunately forgot how to sleep (temporarily), and while this can seem quite scary at the time, all you gotta remember is that you're gonna be fine and you can just lie down calmly and wait for the nightmares to go away, and then you'll wake up a day later feeling very calm and peaceful, and then all you have to do re-learn how the real world might differ from any of the 8-hour dreams you've just been in

      that depends how smart of a mood i'm in

      it's hard to tell which inspiration is biggest, because of the non-euclidean spherical space that inspiration lives in

8.5.21  8:20 pm   How come 5/4 sounds so uncomfortable sometimes?

      possibly because you and the songwriter are on somewhat different life paths at the moment

8.5.21  6:09 pm   i forgot if i still exist or not, how do you figure out if you are still existing

      a general rule i go by: if you are wondering if you exist, then you exist. that's a classic existence move right there

8.5.21  6:03 pm   i really wonder the deeper reasons and thinking behind you not wanting to make an album. you often answer that with "songs are stronger one at a time" which makes a lot of sense, and i guess i can grasp the idea of what you mean by that. however the experience of listening to n many amount of songs and an album which is n songs long feels really really different to me?

     i always expected that to be true because a lot of people say it is, but it's not, for me. i really wanted it to be true so i've tried it many times with many different albums and it never seems true for me. the good news is i found out it is true for other things, things that are more than just songs

     and also, i see no reason behind why the songs included in the album should lose the power of them being experienced one at a time.

     it reminds me of how meals have their greatest effect when eaten 1 at a time

      if you craft it with ingenuity, which you always do at all of your crafts in my opinion as far as the works you have currently made go, they could still be considered as n separate songs if wanted to by the experiencer. however, give a much differently beautiful, not stronger by definition (let's hope that both experiences have the same amount of strength which is as strong as possible) ocean of feelings, with a longer ride i guess?

     if it's the longer ride, then the plea i would usually make is: 'please make it more than just songs.' A song's best friend is something that's not a song, and vice versa

      being in control of the order o f recommended listening, being able to do lots of interesting twists and turns by simply i dont know putting in some interlude tracks or whatever _you_ are going to invent at that road, and therefore a longer greater narrative outside the singular ones could turn into something deeper emotionally, with more investment.

     then please, please, (i would argue), make it more than just songs. i think this plays directly into the 'more' theme you are going for here, and i'm wondering why, in such a 'more' theme, you'd want to restrict it something so narrow as just a series of audio tracks

      the songs that can still be experienced as single pieces which are strong enough for them to be considered "good", could also have a double triple however many as you much meaning at the whole picture, and n many songs could still be themselves in their own way? one doesn't even need to publish them one at a time, simply just planning the whole process at the writing is enough to make it so, i guess, and they could come as singles, when finished also as a whole with the extra album touches if necessary. and as far as i understood you have no problems in the writing departmant which comes like a natural language to you. this would only differentiate the process of writ ing, the amount of production that will be needed to put in would not rise, since there are still n many of songs which is lesser than the amount that you are already going to make? maybe i'm a sucker for continuity and your work and just want to listen to an album that has been made from you, i don't know. but you also don't seem like being a person who willingly refuses having more meaning, especially when the work going to be done is not exponentially increasing, which it doesn't seem like at this case. am i missing something?

     i think so. i think you are putting me on the wrong side of the argument. i am arguing for something 'more' meaningful than an album, not less. in my opinion, at the length of an album, there's much stronger ways to use the same amount of time, in terms of creative audio/visual content. in my opinion

     i would love to hear your reasoning behind not wanting to make albums in more depth, but for me it feels like those pictures made from other pictures square by square, it doesn't have to be like a jigsaw puzzle, pieces don't need to feel empty at any time, but still, you can have n beautiful pictures and a bigger greater +1, as a bonus, with nothing to lose.   

     for me personally, the downside to an album is the icky feeling it gives me when listening to it, and the inevitable fruitless search for 'which of these songs i like', (which bizarely always seems to be almost none). And yet, contrarily, any one of those songs can readily become a full blown anthem of life, when found/presented in a more specialized context: such as in a motion picture, or other significant life event

     thank you for all the inspiration and constant reminders of me having free will, it seems like i really do need that sometimes, and your work always finds a subtle way to ring that bell. sorry for the wall of text.

8.5.21  5:21 pm   do you exist

8.5.21  4:32 pm   How do I not be stupid.

      you might as well go ahead and be all the stupid, first, to get it out of the way

8.5.21  4:32 pm   Hi Bill, I was watching one of your music videos (Slow Down), and you gave the public a look into your video creation process.

     that part was fictional satire

     I have tried replicating your steps, but I've had some trouble exploiting that computer glitch. Could you help me with this problem?

      the bad news is i may be 1,000 steps ahead of your on video making BUT, the good news is, because i may be an idiot, i have a tendency to do about 900 too many steps. To take it back to the root of the problem, the first thing you wanna do if you are working on a computer is: find the Export. Find the feature of your computer that actually makes a video file, in 1 file, such as mp4, that you can play in a video player. Everything else is just working backwards from there, figuring out how to change what video it is. Expand the possibilities 1 step at a time. If your video file starts entirely black, the next thing i can suggest is try to make part of it white. If the whole thing is silent, the next step will be to try to make at least some of it non-silent. and take a picture of yourself doing it so you can remember how simplicity works, in case you find yourself in a complicated emergency later on down the road

8.5.21  4:25 pm   i write music a lot, but I normally start with the instrumental and do melody/lyrics later, but i noticed while browsing through questions that you start with melody/lyrics first and then the harmony comes to you later.

     that's mostly not true. the harmony is usually 80% baked into any melody. it's kind of like how most houses come with furniture, and even if you change the furniture it's still gonna be pretty close, like you're not gonna have the refrigerater in the tub, except maybe once in a while

     because you seem so efficient and you write songs that seem so perfect, it makes me feel I should do melody/lyrics first, and that just doesn't work well for me. it makes me wonder if there's an inherently wrong way to pursue my songwriting and if I should change my work process to match a more correct way?

     there's at least 8000 ways. you should change back and forth between changing the way and keeping the same way. so in other words, you should keep doing it the same way sometimes

8.5.21  2:52 pm   thoughts on bad things

      underrated

8.5.21  2:50 pm   What is your favorite song that you have made?

      i would prefer to make a new one to be my favorite

8.5.21  1:49 pm   how do you feel about setting consistent schedule markers for skills i want to learn, i.e. "play guitar 10 minutes a day, spend 10 minutes a day learning spanish, writing 750 words a day", that kind of build-your-own-structure thing?

      that sounds ok. if you can come up with just the right percentages, you can dream it up into a pizza you can't refuse

8.5.21  12:25 pm   will u ever change up your content now that you do 3d aswell?

      i'm looking to change it immediately, in whatever ways necessary to make it viable for actual production of the ongoing stream of content i write, at scale

8.5.21  10:44 am   Can you expand on this please: "if you can learn to understand the noise, then it will seem calm"? Like if you hear someone banging a wall, how would understanding that noise make it seem calm?

      that's what we always do. Actually, our entire existence is making sense of immense noise. the cacophony of electrical signals hitting your brain, the sight and sound, your entire nervous system, .... you are being bombarded by information. it can take a human person at least a couple years just to figure out how to make sense of the basics. to walk, talk, identify objects, etc. But eventually, once you familiarize yourself with those things, they seem normal, and they become part of a normalized baseline state. You'll also notice that when people are sleeping with any type of noise or activity going on, they tend to be more likely to wake up when the noise changes. The more you understand what's making the sounds you're hearing, you can accept them into your reality fairly lovingly

8.5.21  10:20 am   why do people think good songs and poems need to have a rhyming scheme??

      they could possibly be in a cult

8.5.21  5:22 am   how can I get started on making new music?

      first figure out how it goes. You will probably be disappointed to find out, right away, that you can't decide how it goes. so in that case i can suggest a fairly constructive alternative: start making a list of ways it COULD go
